member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment
member.summary:
An adjustment that alters a date if it falls on a day other than a business day.
When processing dates in finance, it is typically intended that non-business days,
such as weekends and holidays, are converted to a nearby valid business day.
This class represents the necessary adjustment.

member.name: F:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.NoAdjustment
member.summary: An instance that performs no adjustment.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.BusinessDayConvention
member.summary:
The convention used to the adjust the date if it does not fall on a business day.
The convention determines whether to move forwards or backwards when it is a holiday.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.HolidayCalendar
member.summary:
The calendar that defines holidays and business days.
When the adjustment is made, this calendar is used to skip holidays.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.Adjuster
member.summary: A DateAdjuster that adjusts a date according to the business day convention and holiday calendar.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.#ctor(B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.IBusinessDayConvention,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified business day convention and holiday calendar.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayAdjustment.Adjust(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Adjusts the date as necessary if it is not a business day.
If the date is a business day it will be returned unaltered.
If the date is not a business day, the convention will be applied.
member.returns: The adjusted date

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.BusinessDayNoAdjust
member.summary:
The 'NoAdjust' convention which makes no adjustment.
The input date will not be adjusted even if it is not a business day.

member.name: F:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.BusinessDayNoAdjust.NoAdjust
member.summary: No adjustment is made to the date, even if it is not a business day.

member.name: F:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.BusinessDayNoAdjust.BusinessDayConventionName
member.summary: The name of the Business Day Convention.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.IBusinessDayConvention
member.summary:
A convention defining how to adjust a date if it falls on a day other than a business day.
The purpose of this convention is to define how to handle non-business days.
When processing dates in finance, it is typically intended that non-business days,
such as weekends and holidays, are converted to a nearby valid business day.
The convention, in conjunction with a ,
defines exactly how the adjustment should be made.
The most common implementations are provided in .
Additional implementations may be added by implementing this interface.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.IBusinessDayConvention.Adjust(System.DateOnly,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar)
member.summary:
Adjusts the date as necessary if it is not a business day.
If the date is a business day it will be returned unaltered.
If the date is not a business day, the convention will be applied.
member.param: The calendar that defines holidays and business days
member.returns: The adjusted date

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.IBusinessDayConventionFactory
member.summary: Provides a factory for creating business day conventions.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.BusinessDayConventions.IBusinessDayConventionFactory.BusinessDayConventionNames
member.summary: Retrieves the names of all available business day conventions.
member.returns: A collection of business day convention names.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.DateAdjuster
member.summary: Represents a method that adjusts a value based on custom logic.
member.returns: A new value that represents the adjusted date.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.DayCount
member.summary: A convention defining how to calculate fractions of a year.
member.remarks:
The purpose of this convention is to define how to convert dates into numeric year fractions.
This is of use when calculating accrued interest over time.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.DayCount.YearFraction(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Gets the year fraction between the specified dates.
Given two dates, this method returns the fraction of a year between these
dates according to the convention. The dates must be in order.
member.param: The second date, on or after the
member.returns: The year fraction, zero or greater

member.summary: JSON converter for .

member.summary: JSON converter for .

member.summary: Writes a to JSON as a string representation of its name.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.CombinedHolidayCalendar
member.summary:
A holiday calendar implementation that combines two other calendars.
This immutable implementation of stores two underlying calendars.
A date is a holiday if either calendar defines it as a holiday.

member.name: F:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.CombinedHolidayCalendar.Joiner
member.summary: Joiner character for combining two calendars.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.CombinedHolidayCalendar.Calendar1
member.summary: Calendar 1.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.CombinedHolidayCalendar.Calendar2
member.summary: Calendar 2.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.CombinedHolidayCalendar.#ctor(B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar)
member.summary: Combines two holiday calendars into one.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar
member.summary:
A holiday calendar, classifying dates as holidays or business days.
Many calculations in finance require knowledge of whether a date is a business day or not.
This interface encapsulates that knowledge, with each day treated as a holiday or a business day.
Weekends are effectively treated as a special kind of holiday.
Applications should refer to holidays using .
The name must be resolved to a
before the holiday data methods can be accessed.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.IsHoliday(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Checks if the specified date is a holiday.
This is the opposite of .

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.IsBusinessDay(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Checks if the specified date is a business day.
This is the opposite of .

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.AdjustBy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an adjuster that changes the date.
member.param: The number of business days to adjust by

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.Shift(System.DateOnly,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Shifts the date by a specified number of business days.
If the number of days is zero, the original date is returned.
If the number of days is positive, the date is shifted forward. Later business days are chosen.
If the number of days is negative, the date is shifted backward. Earlier business days are chosen.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.Next(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Finds the next business day, always returning a later date.
Given a date, this method returns the next business day.
member.returns: The first business day after the input date

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.NextOrSame(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Finds the next business day, returning the input date if it is a business day.
Given a date, this method returns a business day.
If the input date is a business day, it is returned.
Otherwise, the next business day is returned.
member.returns: The input date if it is a business day, or the next business day

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.Previous(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Finds the previous business day, always returning an earlier date.
Given a date, this method returns the previous business day.
member.returns: The first business day before the input date

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.PreviousOrSame(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Finds the previous business day, returning the input date if it is a business day.
Given a date, this method returns a business day.
If the input date is a business day, it is returned.
Otherwise, the previous business day is returned.
member.returns: The input date if it is a business day, or the previous business day

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.NextSameOrLastInMonth(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Finds the next business day within the month, returning the input date if it is a business day,
or the last business day of the month if the next business day is in a different month.
Given a date, this method returns a business day.
If the input date is a business day, it is returned.
If the next business day is within the same month, it is returned.
Otherwise, the last business day of the month is returned.
Note that the result of this method may be earlier than the input date.
This corresponds to the 'BusinessDayModifiedFollowing' business day convention.
member.returns: The input date if it is a business day, the next business day if within the same month or the last business day of the month

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.IsLastBusinessDayOfMonth(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Checks if the specified date is the last business day of the month.
This returns true if the date specified is the last valid business day of the month.
member.returns: True if the specified date is the last business day of the month

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.LastBusinessDayOfMonth(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Calculates the last business day of the month.
Given a date, this method returns the date of the last business day of the month.
member.returns: The date of the last business day of the month

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.DaysBetween(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Calculates the number of business days between two dates.
This calculates the number of business days within the range.
If the dates are equal, zero is returned.
If the end is before the start, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: The total number of business days between the start and end date

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.BusinessDays(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly)
member.summary: Gets the stream of business days between the two dates.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar.Holidays(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly)
member.summary: Gets the stream of holidays between the two dates.

member.summary: Represents a factory for creating Holiday Calendars.

member.summary: Retrieves the names of all available holiday calendars.

member.summary:
Combines this holiday calendar with another.
The resulting calendar will declare a day as a business day if it is a
business day in both source calendars.
member.returns: The combined calendar

member.summary:
Links two holiday calendars together.
The resulting calendar will declare a day as a business day if it is a
business day in either source calendar.
member.returns: The linked calendar

member.summary:
A holiday calendar implementation that links two other calendars.
This immutable implementation of stores two underlying calendars.
A date is a holiday if both calendars defines it as a holiday.

member.summary: Joiner character for linking two calendars.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.NoHolidaysCalendar
member.summary:
An identifier for a calendar declaring no holidays and no weekends, with code 'NoHolidays'.
This calendar has the effect of making every day a business day.
It is often used to indicate that a holiday calendar does not apply.

member.summary: No Holidays Calendar.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount
member.summary: Common interface for day count conventions.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.YearFraction(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo)
member.summary:
Gets the year fraction between the specified dates.
Given two dates, this method returns the fraction of a year between these
dates according to the convention. The dates must be in order.
member.param: The second date, on or after the
member.returns: The year fraction, zero or greater

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.Days(System.DateOnly,System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Calculates the number of days between the specified dates using the rules of this day count.
A day count is typically defines as a count of days divided by a year estimate.
This method returns the count of days, which is the numerator of the division.
For example, the 'Act/Act' day count will return the actual number of days between
the two dates, but the '30/360 ISDA' will return a value based on 30 day months.
member.returns: The number of days, as determined by the day count

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo
member.summary:
Information about the schedule necessary to calculate the day count.
Some implementations require additional information about the schedule.
Implementations of this interface provide that information.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo.StartDate
member.summary:
The start date of the schedule.
The first date in the schedule.
If the schedule adjusts for business days, then this is the adjusted date.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo.EndDate
member.summary:
The end date of the schedule.
The last date in the schedule.
If the schedule adjusts for business days, then this is the adjusted date.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo.PeriodEndDate(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Gets the end date of the schedule period.
This is called when a day count requires the end date of the schedule period.
member.param: The date to find the period end date for
member.returns: The period end date

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IDayCount.IScheduleInfo.Frequency
member.summary:
The periodic frequency of the schedule.
This is called when a requires the periodic frequency of the schedule.

member.summary: Represents a factory for creating day count conventions.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IPeriodAdditionConvention
member.summary:
A convention defining how a period is added to a date.
The purpose of this convention is to define how to handle the addition of a period.
The default implementations include two different end-of-month rules.
The convention is generally only applicable for month-based periods.
Implementations of this interface are provided in

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IPeriodAdditionConvention.Adjust(System.DateOnly,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.Period,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.HolidayCalendars.IHolidayCalendar)
member.summary:
Adjusts the base date, adding the period and applying the convention rule.
The adjustment occurs in two steps.
First, the period is added to the based date to create the end date.
Second, the end date is adjusted by the convention rules.
member.returns: The adjusted date

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IPeriodAdditionConvention.IsMonthBased
member.summary:
Checks whether the convention requires a month-based period.
A month-based period contains only months and/or years, and not days.

member.summary: Provides a factory for creating Period Addition Conventions.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.IPeriodAdditionConventionFactory.PeriodAdditionConventionNames
member.summary: Retrieves the names of all available Period Addition Conventions.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.Period
member.summary:
Represents a period of time in ISO 8601 format (date components only).
Periods can be expressed in years, months, and days (Y/M/D) or weeks (W).
If weeks are specified, they cannot be combined with years, months, or days in the same period. If Period contains weeks, it is considered a week-based period. If Period contains only years, months, and days, it is considered a date-based period. Examples: P1Y, P6M, P3W, P10D, P1Y2M10D, P0D.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.Period.TryFormat(System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32@,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Formats as ISO 8601 (e.g., "P1Y2M", "P0D"). Supported format specifiers: - null or "G": default (no transformation) - "N": normalize months into years - "W": compress days into weeks if no Y/M and divisible by 7 - "C": canonical (N + W)

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.Tenor
member.summary:
A tenor indicating how long it will take for a financial instrument to reach maturity.
A tenor is allowed to be any non-negative non-zero period of days, weeks, month or years.
Each tenor is based on a . The months and years of the period are not normalized,
thus it is possible to have a tenor of 12 months and a different one of 1 year.
When used, standard date addition rules apply, thus there is no difference between them.
Call to apply normalization.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.TenorAdjustment
member.summary:
An adjustment that alters a date by adding a tenor.
This adjustment adds a to the input date using an addition convention,
followed by an adjustment to ensure the result is a valid business day.
Addition is performed using standard calendar addition.
It is not possible to add a number of business days using this class. See for an alternative that can handle addition of business days.
There are two steps in the calculation:
In step one, the period is added using the specified .
In step two, the result of step one is optionally adjusted to be a business day using a .
member.remarks:
For example, a rule represented by this class might be:
"the end date is 5 years after the start date, with end-of-month rule based on the last business day of the month, adjusted to be a valid London business day using the 'ModifiedFollowing' convention".

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Date.TenorAdjustment.Tenor
member.summary:
The tenor to be added.
When the adjustment is performed, this tenor will be added to the input date.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency
member.summary:
A periodic frequency used by financial products that have a specific event every so often.
Frequency is primarily intended to be used to subdivide events within a year.
A frequency is allowed to be any non-negative .
A special value, , is provided for when there are no subdivisions of the entire term.
This is also known as 'zero-coupon' or 'once'.

member.name: F:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.Term
member.summary:
A periodic frequency matching the term.
Also known as zero-coupon.
This is represented using .
There are no events per year with this frequency.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.Name
member.summary:
Gets the name of the frequency.
For the term frequency this is "Term", otherwise the ISO 8601 period text.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.Period
member.summary: Period of the frequency.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.EventsPerYear
member.summary: Exact whole number of events per (synthetic) year, or -1 if not an even divisor of 12 months (month-based) or 364 days (day/week-based).

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.EventsPerYearEstimate
member.summary: Estimated events per year (decimal). -1 when not computable under current rules.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.HasExactEventsPerYear
member.summary: Indicates this frequency has an exact integral events-per-year value (EventsPerYear > 0).

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsRegular
member.summary: Alias for (semantic clarity in some domains).

member.summary: Constructs a frequency based on the specified period.

member.summary: Parses a frequency from its string representation.
member.param: The string representation (either "Term" or ISO 8601 period).
member.returns: The parsed frequency.
member.exception: Thrown when the value cannot be parsed.

member.summary: Tries to parse a frequency from its string representation.
member.returns: True if parsing succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.TryFromEventsPerYear(System.Int32,System.Nullable{B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency}@)
member.summary: Attempts to construct a frequency from an integer events-per-year value. Supports: - Month-based divisors of 12 (e.g. 12, 6, 4, 3, 2, 1) - Week-based divisors of 52 - Day-based divisors of 364 Returns false if no exact canonical period can be produced.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.FromEventsPerYear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a frequency from events per year, throwing an exception if not possible.
member.returns: A frequency instance.
member.exception: Thrown when eventsPerYear cannot be represented as an exact frequency.

member.summary: Deconstructs the frequency into its core components.

member.summary: String representation of the frequency.
member.returns: The frequency name.

member.summary: Indicates if the frequency is the term frequency.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsWeekBased
member.summary: Indicates if the periodic frequency is based on weeks.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsMonthBased
member.summary: Indicates if the periodic frequency is based on months.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsDayBased
member.summary: Indicates if the periodic frequency is based on days.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsAnnual
member.summary:
Checks if the periodic frequency is annual.
An annual frequency consists of 12 months.
The period must be exactly 12 months with no weeks or days.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsQuarterly
member.summary: Checks if the periodic frequency is quarterly (3 months).

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.IsMonthly
member.summary: Checks if the periodic frequency is monthly (1 month).

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.ToReciprocal
member.summary: Returns the reciprocal frequency if this frequency has exact events per year. For example, Monthly (12 events) returns Annual (1 event), Quarterly (4 events) returns Annual, etc.
member.returns: The reciprocal frequency.
member.exception: Thrown when the frequency doesn't have exact events per year.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.TryGetReciprocal(B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency@)
member.summary: Attempts to get the reciprocal frequency.
member.returns: True if reciprocal could be computed, false otherwise.

member.summary: Determines if this frequency is compatible with the specified frequency. Frequencies are compatible if they have the same base type (day/week/month).
member.returns: True if the frequencies are compatible.

member.summary: Compares two frequencies for equality.

member.summary: Compares two frequencies for inequality.

member.summary:
Normalizes the months and years of this tenor.
This method returns a tenor of an equivalent length but with any number
of months greater than 12 normalized into a combination of months and years.
member.returns: The normalized tenor

member.summary: Adds a period to a frequency.

member.summary: Adds the current frequency to the specified date and returns the resulting date.
member.param: The starting date to which the frequency will be added.
member.returns: A representing the resulting date after adding the frequency.
member.exception: Thrown if the frequency represents a term and cannot be added to a date.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.ToAddDateAdjuster
member.summary: Creates a that adds the current frequency to a date.

member.summary: Subtracts the current frequency from the specified date and returns the resulting date.
member.param: The starting date from which the frequency will be subtracted.
member.returns: A representing the resulting date after subtracting the frequency.

member.summary: Creates a that subtracts the current frequency from a date.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.TryExactDivide(B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to compute an exact integer factor n such that: this = subFrequency * n for compatible base types (month-based, week-based, or day-based). Returns false when: - Either frequency is Term - Bases differ (month vs week vs day) - Periods are irregular mixed Y/M/D (contain both months>0 and days>0) - Division is not exact
member.param: Candidate sub-frequency (must be same or smaller)

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency.ExactDivide(B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency)
member.summary: Computes an exact integer factor n such that: this = subFrequency * n for compatible base types (month / week / day). Throws when: - Not exact - Bases differ - Term involved - Irregular unsupported period shapes
member.returns: Integer factor (>=1).
member.exception: Division not exact or frequencies incompatible.

member.returns: A instance configured with the specified yearly interval.

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention
member.summary:
A convention defining how to roll dates.
A defines the periodicity of the roll.
When applying the frequency, the roll convention is used to fine tune the dates.
This might involve selecting the last day of the month, or the third Wednesday.
To get the next date in the schedule, take the base date and the
periodic and apply the roll convention.
the roll convention is applied to produce the next schedule date.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention.Adjust(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Adjusts the given date according to the roll convention.
It is recommended to use and rather than
directly using this method.
member.returns: The adjusted date.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention.Matches(System.DateOnly)
member.summary:
Checks if the date matches the rules of the roll convention.
See the description of each roll convention to understand the rule applied.
member.returns: True if the date matches the roll convention; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention.Next(System.DateOnly,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency)
member.summary:
Calculates the next date based on the given date and periodic frequency.
This takes the input date, adds the periodic frequency and adjusts the date
as necessary to match the roll convention rules.
The result will always be after the input date.
member.param: The frequency of the periodic event.
member.returns: The next date based on the roll convention.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention.Previous(System.DateOnly,B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.Frequency)
member.summary:
Calculates the previous date based on the specified starting date and periodic frequency.
This takes the input date, subtracts the periodic frequency and adjusts the date
as necessary to match the roll convention rules.
The result will always be before the input date.
member.param: The frequency of the periodic event.
member.returns: The previous date based on the roll convention.

member.name: P:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConvention.DayOfMonth
member.summary:
Gets the day-of-month that the roll convention implies.
This extracts the day-of-month for simple roll conventions.
The numeric roll conventions will return their day-of-month.
The 'EOM' convention will return 31.
All other conventions will return zero (0).

member.name: T:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConventionFactory
member.summary: Represents a factory for creating roll convention instances.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConventionFactory.RollConventionNames
member.summary: Retrieves the names of all available predefined instances.
member.returns: A collection of predefined Roll Convention names.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConventionFactory.OfDayOfMonth(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Obtains an instance from the day-of-month.
This convention will adjust the input date to the specified day-of-month.
The year and month of the result date will be the same as the input date.
It is intended for use with periods that are a multiple of months.
If the month being adjusted has a length less than the requested day-of-month
then the last valid day-of-month will be chosen. As such, passing 31 to this
method is equivalent to selecting the end-of-month convention.
member.returns: The instance.
member.exception: Thrown when the day-of-month is not between 1 and 31.

member.name: M:B7.Financial.Abstractions.Schedule.IRollConventionFactory.OfDayOfWeek(System.DayOfWeek)
member.summary:
Obtains an instance from the day-of-week.
This convention will adjust the input date to the specified day-of-week.
It is intended for use with that are a multiple of weeks.
In , if the input date is not the required day-of-week,
then the next occurrence of the day-of-week is selected, up to 6 days later.
In , the day-of-week is selected after the frequency is added.
If the calculated date is not the required day-of-week, then the next occurrence
of the day-of-week is selected, up to 6 days later.
In , the day-of-week is selected after the frequency is subtracted.
If the calculated date is not the required day-of-week, then the previous occurrence
of the day-of-week is selected, up to 6 days earlier.
member.returns: The instance.
